channel.title: Simple Biology Question
channel.description:
1. Why does a suspension of isolated chloroplasts, given CO2 and H2O, not synthesize G3P (= PGAL) in the dark?
2. what would have to be added to the suspension for photosynthesis to commence?
greatly appreciated if you can help.

item.title: Simple Biology Question
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

  1. Because since there is no sunlight, ATP isnâ€™t synthesized. ATP is required for the synthesis of G3P.

  2. Energy from the sun (photons).
